brandHighlight.data: For two generations, the Lohr family and their team have been leaders in California winegrowing. Founder Jerry Lohr and his three children Steve, Cynthia, and Lawrence oversee one of the country’s most successful and trusted fine wine labels. With first plantings in Monterey in 1972 and then in Paso Robles in 1986, the J. Lohr team helped write the book on sustainable winegrowing on the Central Coast. Today, J. Lohr farms more than 4,000 acres of estate vineyards in Monterey’s Arroyo Seco and Santa Lucia Highlands appellations, Paso Robles, and St. Helena in the Napa Valley. J. Lohr Vineyards & Wines produces eight tiers of award-winning releases: J. Lohr Sig­na­ture Caber­net Sauvi­gnon, J. Lohr Cuvée Series, J. Lohr Vine­yard Series, J. Lohr Ges­ture, J. Lohr Pure Paso Pro­pri­etary Red Wine, J. Lohr Estates, J. Lohr Mon­terey Roots, and ARIEL Vine­yards. J. Lohr was honored with the 2020 Green Medal Leader Award in recognition of the company’s decades-long commitment to sustainability. JLohr.com is the winery’s online home.

description.data:
The J. Lohr Pure Paso Proprietary Red Wine is exactly what the name suggests: authentic Paso Robles winegrowing history captured in a bottle. J. Lohr Pure Paso artfully blends Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah – two J. Lohr benchmark varieties – into a unique proprietary red wine. The two varieties have long been intertwined in J. Lohr’s winegrowing history and, in particular, the Lohr family’s pioneering efforts in the Paso Robles region.

This Pure Paso Proprietary Red Wine highlights J. Lohr’s house-style, which is acclaimed for its dense and focused fruit signature, coupled with a soft, approachable palate. Its classic, dramatic packaging recalls Paso Robles’ frontier ethos. It is our delicious, proprietary tribute to one of the world’s great winegrowing regions – a special place that J. Lohr is proud to call home.

tastingNotesText.data: Savory varietal notes of Cabernet Sauvignon are layered with the overt dark fruit character of Petite Sirah. The bouquet of cocoa powder, caramel, and anise works in harmony with the black cherry fruit signature of this wine. Bright and focused on the palate with a firm and appetizing finish.

brandHighlight.data: For two generations, the Lohr family and their team have been leaders in California winegrowing. Founder Jerry Lohr and his three children Steve, Cynthia, and Lawrence oversee one of the country’s most successful and trusted fine wine labels. With first plantings in Monterey in 1972 and then in Paso Robles in 1986, the J. Lohr team helped write the book on sustainable winegrowing on the Central Coast. Today, J. Lohr farms more than 4,000 acres of estate vineyards in Monterey’s Arroyo Seco and Santa Lucia Highlands appellations, Paso Robles, and St. Helena in the Napa Valley. J. Lohr Vineyards & Wines produces eight tiers of award-winning releases: J. Lohr Sig­na­ture Caber­net Sauvi­gnon, J. Lohr Cuvée Series, J. Lohr Vine­yard Series, J. Lohr Ges­ture, J. Lohr Pure Paso Pro­pri­etary Red Wine, J. Lohr Estates, J. Lohr Mon­terey Roots, and ARIEL Vine­yards. J. Lohr was honored with the 2020 Green Medal Leader Award in recognition of the company’s decades-long commitment to sustainability. JLohr.com is the winery’s online home.

description.data: The predominant source for our J. Lohr Estates Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon program is our vineyard located directly opposite our J. Lohr Paso Robles Wine Center, plus two newer sites just to the north (J. Lohr Sinclair and J. Lohr Jones ranches). The original Seven Oaks vineyard was planted on its own rootstock, utilizing some of the indigenous Estrella clones widely planted in Paso Robles. The soils in our vineyards vary from gravelly clay loam to limestone-based, over a relatively small parcel of land; various rootstock and clonal combinations have been used to maximize the expression of each individual site and the eventual wine’s layered complexity. The J. Lohr Estates Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon is dense and dark at the core. Ripe fruit aromas of black cherry and currant are accented by notes of toasted pastry, hazelnut, and vanilla from our extensive barrel aging program. Big, juicy red-fruit flavors infuse the palate while softly textured tannins lead to a long, gratifying finish.

tastingNotesText.data: The original Cabernet Sauvignon from this pioneering Central Coast winery helped define the Paso Robles style. Deep flavors of black cherry, cassis, and toasted pastry with a soft, juicy mouthfeel and long finish.

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1973 as a vineyard company, Sonoma-Cutrer has a long-standing reputation of craftsmanship. Its uncommon attention to detail and exceptional quality caused demand for its grapes to grow quickly. Based on that early success, its founders assembled a group of world-renowned, forward-thinking experts to develop a state-of-the-art winery.

text.data: Ambient

description.data: Sonoma-Cutrer Sonoma Coast Chardonnay Dry White Wine reflects a balance of fruit flavors and oak aging for a fuller-bodied wine with elements of a classic chardonnay. This dry chardonnay wine is a pale to medium beautiful straw color and explodes out of the glass with aromas of apricot, nectarine and melon. These fruit aromas are combined with notes of oak spice accented with hints of vanilla, toasted nuts and a touch of butterscotch. With rich flavors of ripe pear and peach, this is a bottle of wine you serve when you want to show people you care about them. Marrying Burgundian practices with Californian innovation, Sonoma-Cutrer produces wine of elegantly rich California chardonnay unlike any other. This medium-bodied white chardonnay wine delivers rich, creamy flavors contrasted with vibrant acidity and a long barrel spice finish. This Sonoma-Cutrer white wine has a 13.9% alcohol by volume, and you can enjoy it on its own or pair it with risotto, chicken or seafood dishes.

advices.data: This classic, medium-bodied Sonoma Coast Chardonnay is a staple for any white wine lover and pairs well with smokey cheeses, late summer vegetables, pasta, and salads. If you are looking for the perfect entre pairing, try a Couscous Risotto.

text.data: California wine with rich flavors of ripe pear and peach
Fruit aromas with oak spice notes and hints of vanilla

flavorStatement.data: Aromas of nectarine, stone fruit, white peach and oak spice are accented with hints of vanilla, toasted nuts and a touch of butterscotch and light caramel with a subtle cinnamon spice undertone. This wine has the distinctive Sonoma-Cutrer balance between elegance and richness for a medium-bodied, mouth-filling wine. The creamy texture of this wine offers flavors of ripe pear and peach that is balanced with a nice, bright acidity. There is lots of finesse’ to the long, silky finish highlighted with long barrel spice notes. This classic, medium-bodied Sonoma Coast Chardonnay is a staple for any wine lover and pairs well with smokey cheeses. many pasta dishes, and late summer vegetables. Try a glass with our asparagus ravioli in brown butter sauce for an exceptional wine experience.

brandHighlight.data: Sycamore Lane produces some of the most popular varietals in the world, and it all starts with carefully selected grapes that are grown in California’s most respected wine regions. With varietals of White Zinfandel, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon available, Sycamore Lane produces wines that meet the tastes of a discerning palate and that can pair well with great food.

description.data: Sycamore Lane Merlot Red Wine displays fresh, cherry-like varietal aromas, with hints of tobacco and herbal spice.  Medium-bodied, with a smooth texture and soft tannins, it boasts rich, lingering flavors of cherries and plums. The wine fermented for a week at 85 degrees Fahrenheit and after settling and racking, was aged for approximately one year in a combination of new and used American oak tanks and casks prior to bottling. Sycamore Lane produces a smooth, easy drinking style of Merlot, enjoyable with many types of food. Enjoy this fine wine as an excellent accompaniment to a wide range of foods, especially chicken, beef, lamb, game, and tomato-based pastas. One 750mL bottle of wine has 13.4% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Sycamore Lane produces some of the most popular varietals in the world, and it all starts with carefully selected grapes that are grown in California’s most respected wine regions. With varietals of White Zinfandel, Pinot Grigio, Chardonnay, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon available, Sycamore Lane produces wines that meet the tastes of a discerning palate and that can pair well with great food.

description.data: Sycamore Lane Chardonnay White Wine exhibits enticing aromas of fresh apple, pear, citrus and peach flavors. The aromas are enriched by toasty, buttery tones imparted by partial malolactic fermentation and wood aging. This white wine has a slightly toasted, creamy tone yielding a wine akin in style and quality to super-premium California Chardonnays. The growing season allowed the Chardonnay grapes to enjoy a “hang time” on the vine, which developed the grapes’ full, rich flavors. The Chardonnay is cold-fermented in stainless steel tanks to fully capture the varieties flavors. This white wine is balanced by crisp acidity making it an ideal match for any seafood or poultry dish, as well as veal or pork chops, cream sauce pastas and both mild and hearty cheeses. This Chardonnay white wine produces a smooth, easy drinking style of wine designed to be enjoyable upon release. One 750mL wine bottle of Sycamore Lane Chardonnay, 13.1% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Live life in the sunshine with Del Mar Agave Wine Margarita. Crafted in Mexican tradition, Del Mar is made with Organic Blue Weber Agave Wine sourced from Jalisco, Mexico, real fruit juice, and all-natural flavors, resulting in a classically delicious Margarita. Del Mar, meaning “of the sea”, knows life by the ocean. All it takes is one sip to take you to a beach state of mind!

brandHighlight.data: AMERICA'S #1 ALCOHOL REMOVED WINE! When you—or your guests—opt not to drink alcohol, Fre delivers a refined alternative to blasé sodas and flavored water. We craft our delicious, alcohol-removed wines for everyday enjoyment, whether you’re relaxing on the couch mid-week or hosting an elegant baby shower. Every sip of Fre reflects California’s acclaimed wine regions. We make our wine using traditional methods, then we carefully remove the alcohol, while preserving the wine’s delicate flavors. The result is the perfect wine experience—without the alcohol.

description.data: FRE Alcohol-Removed Sparkling Rosé is produced from premium California wine. A crisp and refreshing sparkling pink, alcohol-removed wine with notes of delicious ripe strawberries and citrus. This bubbly is beautifully balanced with a dry, refreshing finish. Each FRE non-alcoholic wine is crafted using traditional winemaking methods. Once crafted, the wine goes through state-of-the-art spinning cone technology to remove the alcohol while safeguarding the fragile wine aromas and flavors. The finished product is a fresh, delicious beverage with the characteristic aromas and flavors of premium wine without the alcohol. This bottled wine has less than 0.5% alcohol by volume and half the calories of regular wine. FRE is America's #1 alcohol-removed wine.

brandHighlight.data: Fresh, clean and vibrant, Liquid Light sparks wonder and motivation to be our best “self” we can be.

description.data: Revel in the luminescent allure of Liquid Light Sauvignon Blanc. This white wine will mesmerize your senses like a water droplet diffracts sunlight into a kaleidoscopic burst of hues. Each sip of this Sauvignon Blanc white wine opens with harmonious flavors of citrus, tropical, and orchard fruit, held together by a streak of acidity - a testament to Washington State's cool climate. Crafted solely from Sauvignon Blanc grapes meticulously handpicked from Washington State, its aromatic profile is irresistible with hints of crisp green pineapple, invigorating lime zest, and refreshing pink grapefruit. Liquid Light Sauvignon Blanc transforms your meals, pairing perfectly with soft cheeses, smoky grilled vegetables, fresh oysters, rosemary chicken, succulent garlic butter scallops, or the flavorful complexity of Thai cuisine.

tastingNotesText.data: Elevate your white wine experience with Liquid Light Sauvignon Blanc, a guilt-free delight showcasing green pineapple, lime zest, pink grapefruit along with hints of mandarin orange and jasmine, refreshing acidity, and a low calorie count.

text.data: Bright gold colour and subtle sparkle an inviting  prelude  to  rich  nuances  of  white  flowers  and  white-fleshed  fruit
A  long,  expansive  finish  testifies  to  the  rare  quality  of  this  exceptional champagne.
A generous, lively attack and a lush, creamy texture. Floral notes of linden blossom, complemented by pear, mandarin and grapefruit zest.
Perrier-Jouët Belle Epoque Brut is Floral & Elegant - a true icon and celebration of art in winemaking, highlighting the elegance of Chardonnay.

Founded in 1811 by Nicolas Perrier and Adèle Jouët. The foundation of the estate, located in Épernay, has always been chardonnay. The maison owns 65 hectares of vineyards, 99.2% of which is Grand Cru, including sites in the Côte des Blancs - Cramant and Avize. This cuvée is inspired by the historic Blason de France (1955-1990), Perrier-Jouët’s first prestige bottling, in partnership with Relais & Chateau, offered only in the finest restaurants worldwide. The bottle’s slender neck and slight taper are modeled after this original cuvée.

brandHighlight.data: Mason is quintessential Napa Valley—crafting classic California wines from meticulously farmed vineyards since 1993. As a proud pioneer of Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc, founder and winemaker Randy Mason has focused his craft on showcasing the unique character of this dynamic, versatile varietal through the lens of Napa Valley vineyards. A minimalist approach to winemaking lets these distinct sites truly shine, representing a rich history of strong grower relationships with the finest farming practices.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Mason Sauvignon Blanc White Wine is a stunner with extraordinary mouthfeel and texture. This dry white wine greets the nose with citrus, fig and peach. The bright, refreshing palate offers notes of grapefruit and minerality with creamy flavors of lime and citrus. The Mason Sauvignon Blanc 2020 vintage was placed in the 100 Top Values of 2020 with 92 Points from Wine Spectator. This elegant, balanced sauvignon blanc wine pairs well with tarragon shrimp, thyme roasted chicken and linguine with pesto. Mason Sauvignon Blanc is crafted using grapes that are certified organic and exclusively sourced from the Yount Mill Vineyard. The dry white wine is fermented at a cool 50 F for 30 to 35 days, with 18% of the wine put down to stainless steel drums. The cold fermentation accentuates the fruit and retains the aromatic qualities and crisp acidity. This bottled wine has 14.2% alcohol by volume. Mason Cellars has been creating classically styled, California wines in the Napa Valley since 1993. They pride themselves on high-quality sourcing through long-term grower relationships and cultivating grapes on their own property.

brandHighlight.data: We started with premium Cabernet Sauvignon sourced from California’s prestigious North Coast AVA and 198 Kentucky bourbon barrels — and Batch No. 198 was born. First, we fermented the Cabernet to develop its deep color, firm structure and silky mouthfeel. Next, we aged the wine for three months in oak barrels previously used to craft 6 year-old Kentucky bourbon. Aging in bourbon barrels lends a unique flavor profile to the wine, imparting subtle whisky notes of vanilla, brown sugar, smoke and spices. After aging, we blended the Cabernet with a hint of Merlot and Petite Sirah for added balance and depth.

description.data: Batch No 198 Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine fuses legendary California winemaking with the time-honored traditions of Southern craft distillers, delivering a dry red wine with a unique, indulgent flavor profile that is sure to appeal to craft spirits enthusiasts and wine lovers alike. Aromas of cherries, caramel and sweet leather lead to complex layers of blackberry, black cherry and plum enhanced by nuances of toasted vanilla, smoke and spice imparted by bourbon barrels. The 2018 vintage received 91 Points from the Tasting Panel in the March 2020 issue. Savor a glass of this red wine Cabernet Sauvignon with juicy porterhouse steaks or bison burgers. Batch No 198 Cabernet Sauvignon bottled wine is crafted in small batches using fruit from California's prestigious North Coast. Fermented to develop firm structure and a silky mouthfeel, this Cabernet Sauvignon wine is aged in oak Kentucky bourbon barrels for three months, then blended with Merlot and Petite Sirah for balance. This bottled wine is 14.9% alcohol by volume. Every bottle is a labor of love, a true marriage of craft and tradition.

brandHighlight.data: Of Cherokee descent, winemaker Derek Rohlffs was gifted the name “Winter Hawk” as a young boy. Intuitively connected to the land—Cherokee means “those who live in the mountains”—Derek has always felt a mysterious pull to nature, even as a child. To hear him tell it, the vineyard is his destiny. He doesn’t view his path to winemaking as a conscious choice, but more of an undercurrent that quietly ushered him to where he belongs. Today, Derek welcomes the sight of hawks circling over the vineyards and swooping down to the earth around him. A single hawk’s feather fittingly graces the Bravium label, echoing the power, elegance, and vitality of the wines—and of Derek’s Cherokee roots.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Bravium Russian River Valley Chardonnay Wine was created by winemaker Derek Rohlffs. Bravium is a collection of hillside and mountainside fruit from cool–climate vineyards of Sonoma’s Russian River Valley and Mendocino’s Anderson Valley. This brilliant yellow gold white wine has aromas of honey, pear, apple, pineapple, lemon oil, damp soil and white flower with a hint of vanillin oak. The wine opens brightly with lushly textured tropical fruit that transitions to citrus lemon and lime, apple, apricot and nectarine fruit for a full-bodied mid-palate. The 2021 vintage wine received 91 points from James Suckling in September 2022. Pair this white wine with sashimi, sushi, chicken or Cesar salads. Their Chardonnay vineyards are located in the cool-climate of the western portion of California’s Russian River Valley. Two vineyards comprise this wine, located in the small towns of Forestville and Occidental. Both vineyards are regularly blanketed by fog and a view of the Pacific Ocean, with one of them resting directly adjacent to Russian River. The vineyards are planted to a number of Chardonnay selections, including Dijon and Wente vine material which - combined with the large diurnal shift - allows for acidity to be retained during ripening. The combination of these terroir attributes provide prototypical Chardonnay character and hallmark Bravium balance. One 750ml wine bottle of Bravium Russian River Valley Chardonnay is 13.5% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Founded in 1996 by Joel Gott, a 4th generation California vintner, Joel Gott Wines is rooted in authenticity and is committed to crafting fruit-forward, balanced, delicious wines for people to enjoy.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Joel Gott 815 Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine contains fruit sourced from varied regions across California to create an elegant and well-balanced wine. This dry red wine showcases aromas of blackberry and plum. The wine opens with dark, concentrated fruit flavors, followed by velvety tannins on the mid-palate and notes of vanilla on the long, textured finish. This Cabernet Sauvignon wine earned 90 points from James Suckling in November 2021. It is an elegant and balanced dry wine that pairs exceptionally well with steak, asparagus and a charcuterie board. Sourced from vineyards in Napa, Sonoma, Lake County, Central Coast, Mendocino and Lodi, this California wine reflects what each appellation gives to the wine. Joel Gott 815 Cabernet Sauvignon is aged in 30% new American oak for 18 months for exceptional tannin and flavor development. One 375mL wine bottle of Joel Gott 815 Cabernet Sauvignon Red Wine has 13.9% alcohol by volume. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are food friendly and affordable. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. Since 1996, Joel Gott Wines have all the things that matter: structure, sweet fruit, tannins, color, mouthfeel, and they have a great time making it.

brandHighlight.data: Tres Agaves Tequila is 100% de Agave, USDA Certified Organic made in Amatitán, Tequila Valley, Mexico, the historic birthplace of Tequila. Its Blue Weber Agave is grown and harvested by a single source, then fermented and distilled using traditional methods. Tres Agaves Organic Blanco is unaged while Tres Agaves Organic Reposado is aged 9 months in former Tennessee Whiskey and Kentucky Bourbon barrels and Tres Agaves Organic Anejo is aged 18 months exclusively in Kentucky Bourbon barrels. Tres Agaves Organic Tequilas are perfect for sipping or mixing into classic cocktails. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are USDA Certified Organic, low calorie, low glycemic index, and naturally delicious. They contain simple, easy to pronounce ingredients and contain no high fructose corn syrup (HFCS). Simply add Tres Agaves Tequila or your favorite premium Vodka or Rum. Tres Agaves Cocktail Mixers are highly awarded and one of the fastest growing mixer brands in the US.

text.data: Distilled spirits like whiskey, vodka, gin, rum and tequila: Slightly cooler than room temperature, at 55-60 degrees Fahrenheit / 13-16 degrees Celsius.

description.data: Tres Agaves Organic Reposado Tequila is 100% de Agave, sourced from organic agave that's grown in the Tequila Valley and slowly roasted to perfection. Tres Agaves Reposado is aged for approximately 9 months in repurposed Tennessee Whiskey barrels and Kentucky Bourbon barrels. It is one of the most awarded super-premium Tequilas on the market, perfect for sipping or mixing resulting in aromas with baked tropical fruits, complementing barrel notes, and hints of lime juice. An award winning addition to your craft spirits collection. Tres Agaves Reposado tequila received 92 points from the Ultimate Spirits Competition, 93 points from Wine Enthusiast, and won Gold from San Francisco World Spirits Competition. Besides tacos, enchiladas and other Mexican cuisine, try pairing this tequila with grilled seafood or vegetables. Tres Agaves Reposado Tequila is crafted in Amatitan, Jalisco, Mexico, the true historic birthplace of Tequila. This bottle of tequila has 40% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Our timeless American story dates back three generations to when the Trinchero family left their home in New York City to pursue the American Dream in Napa Valley. The family purchased Sutter Home Winery in 1948, after the winery had been closed for almost 30 years due to Prohibition. Still family-owned and now celebrating our 75th anniversary this year, Sutter Home has a long history of delivering wine that people love, starting with the creation of the original White Zinfandel in the 1970s. Sutter Home is proud to be the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion. We were honored to be awarded the Distinguished Service Award for “having introduced more Americans to wine on the table than anyone in history” from Wine Spectator. We will forever stand by our promise to create “a great product for a fair price.”

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Sutter Home Sauvignon Blanc White Wine is a brisk, lively wine made in classic, cool-climate style. Zesty citrus and passionfruit aromas reveal honeydew melon, grapefruit and lime flavors that are accented by spice and mineral notes on the palate. Crisp and refreshing, this dry wine has a classic clean finish. Sutter Home Wine has been awarded 93 points - Gold from 2021 West Coast Wine and 91 points - Gold from 2021 Monterey Int'l. This California wine pairs well with tarragon shrimp, thyme-roasted chicken and linguine with pesto. This wine features grapes sourced from California vineyards. Made in a classic, cool-climate style this wine is cold-fermented and aged exclusively in temperature-controlled stainless steel tanks. Presented in a wine bottle with a screw cap, this wine is convenient to open without a corkscrew. This bottled wine has 13.5% alcohol by volume. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

description.data: Sutter Home Merlot Red Wine is a full-bodied, silky-smooth red wine with delicious fruit characteristics, soft tannins and a rounded mouthfeel. Ripe black cherry aromas with hints of tobacco and herbal spice lead to smoky black cherry and spiced plum flavors on the palate. Sutter Home Merlot wine has earned 90 points - Gold from 2023 Toast of the Coast Wine Competition and Triple Gold-Best of Class from 2022 Dan Berger's International Wine Competition. This dry red wine pairs well with herb-roasted chicken, spaghetti Bolognese and mushroom risotto. The wine making process starts with grapes from premier vineyards in cool coastal regions and warmer inland regions of California. This dry wine is fermented in stainless steel tanks at cool temperatures to preserve its vivid cherry flavors and aromas. This bottled wine has 13.4% alcohol by volume. Sutter Home, family owned since 1948, is the brand generations of wine lovers trust to deliver consistent, award-winning quality and value for every wine occasion.

description.data: Joel Gott Barrel Aged Chardonnay White Wine is filled with aromas of apples, and peaches with notes of honeysuckle and spices. This white wine opens with flavors of crisp apple, with soft tannins and notes of toasted oak and spice with a the long, delicate finish. A Californian wine that can be easily enjoyed with lemon roasted pork or grilled shrimp and shellfish. This California white wine was sourced from vineyards in the Petaluma Gap, Russian River Valley, Arroyo Seco, Santa Rita Hills, Santa Maria Valley and Los Olivos District. Barrel-Aged Chardonnay wine is aged in 50% new French oak and 50% one and two year-old French oak. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Barrel-Aged Chardonnay White has 14.3% alcohol by volume.  Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are food friendly and affordable. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. description.data: Alpha Project Chardonnay grapes are sourced from Monterey County, one of California’s renowned growing regions. This Chardonnay white wine is rich on the palate with aromas of citrus and green apple. The velvety mouthfeel combined with a soft lingering finish is the perfect pairing for creamy pastas and herb chicken. This white wine was enhanced with French and American oak to impart complex, integrated notes of coconut, herbal spice and clove. This Chardonnay is 13.9% alcohol by volume.

brandHighlight.data: Ménage à Trois originated as a blend of three red varietals, created in 1996 by two psychiatric professionals in St. Helena, California. Capturing wine lovers’ imagination through word of mouth, the offering was soon expanded to white and rosé blends. Today the brand is much more then just blends, with over 20 unique offerings. Ménage à Trois continues to thrill wine fans with its unapologetically bold persona and an equally adventurous approach to flavor.

text.data: As a general rule of thumb, wine should be stored around 11-14 degrees Celsius (52-57 degrees Fahrenheit).

description.data: Ignite the romance with silky smooth Menage a Trois Pinot Noir Red Wine. Utterly irresistible, this dry red wine features pretty violet aromas that lead to a symphony of juicy black cherry flavors with hints of toasty oak on the palate. This full-bodied California wine has soft, smooth tannins and a silky finish. The 2020 vintage received 91 Points from the Tasting Panel in the January/February 2023 issue. Pair this Pinot Noir red wine with salmon, duck or roasted vegetables with herbs. This red wine is made with grapes from a trio of premier California appellations known for producing exquisite Pinot Noir: Central Coast, Clarksburg and North Coast regions. During the wine making process, the wine is enhanced with French and American oak. This bottled wine has 13.75% alcohol by volume. Menage a Trois offers a robust portfolio of award-winning wines that consistently delight with a high-quality experience.

description.data: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi Malbec Red Wine is a bold wine that offers juicy fruit flavors of plum and blackberry with a touch of vanilla. Bold aromas of cedar, fresh black cherry and blueberry draw you into a medium bodied wine that's richly complex but approachable. The malbec grapes used in this California red wine are sourced from Lodi, then aged in French and Hungarian oak barrels. The distinctive notes of spicy oak that result allow this malbec wine to pair perfectly with intense meat dishes, such as smoky cured meats, lamb chops or carne asada. It's also delicious to sip on its own. For the best flavor, store this bottle of wine at room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for 30 to 60 minutes before serving. Crafted for over 30 years and perfect for every day, Woodbridge offers approachable fine wine that you don't have to overthink. Please enjoy our wines responsibly. © 2023 Woodbridge Winery, Acampo, CA

description.data: Joel Gott Central Coast Rosé Blush Wine is a delicious dry Provence-style Rosé. This pink wine showcases aromas of strawberry, honeydew, cherries with limeade and citrus notes. On the palate, this blush wine opens with bright fruit flavors and minerality followed by crisp, refreshing acidity and a clean, balanced finish. An award-winning blush wine, Joel Gott Central Coast Rose earned 91 points from Wine Enthusiast and 90 points from James Suckling. Serve this crisp dry pink wine alongside ramen or mahi mahi tacos. The grapes in this California wine are sourced from San Luis Obispo, Monterey and Santa Barbara, all part of the larger Central Coast AVA. After harvest, the fruit was whole cluster pressed upon arrival at the winery. To help preserve the wine’s fruit and natural acidity, reductive winemaking was used to limit the amount of oxygen the wine has exposure to during fermentation in stainless steel tanks. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Central Coast Rosé Blush Wine has 13.6% alcohol by volume. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are food friendly and affordable. Together, the small, dynamic team at Joel Gott Wines shares the same love and dedication for wine making. Since 1996, Joel Gott Wines have all the things that matter: structure, sweet fruit, tannins, color, mouthfeel, and they have a great time making it.

To preserve the wine’s fruit and natural acidity, it undergoes a long, cool fermentation in stainless steel tanks. One 750mL wine bottle of Joel Gott Sauvignon Blanc White Wine has 13.9% alchol by volume. Joel Gott Wines selects the best fruit from a variety of growing regions and blends them to create more balanced, clean, complex and elegant wines that are fun and affordable. Campo Viejo was established in 1959, the current winery opened in 2001. The winery is located 100 meters above Logroño, in the Rioja region of Spain, and is partially built underground and integrated into the landscape. It is the first Spanish winery to be certified as Zero Carbon Footprint, and is staffed a fully female winemaker team.

G.H.Mumm Grand Cordon Brut Champagne is the definitive expression of the Maison Mumm style, driven by the signature grape Pinot Noir.

Maison Mumm: Avant-garde since 1827 in the pursuit of outstanding champagne. Maison Mumm has been a force of change in the making of champagne since its beginnings in 1827, starting with its exceptional parcels of vines and their methods of harvest. This avant-garde vision is rooted in an uncompromising relationship with quality, summarized by Georges Hermann Mumm’s motto: “Nec Plus Ultra” (“Only the Best”). From the first presses installed in the vineyards in 1838 to the launch in 2018 of Mumm Grand Cordon Stellar—the first champagne to be savored at zero gravity—Maison Mumm is a champagne House founded on the idea that innovation is the key to excellence.

Founded in 1811 by Nicolas Perrier and Adèle Jouët. The foundation of the estate, located in Épernay, has always been chardonnay. The maison owns 65 hectares of vineyards, 99.2% of which is Grand Cru, including sites in the Côte des Blancs - Cramant and Avize. This cuvée is inspired by the historic Blason de France (1955-1990), Perrier-Jouët’s first prestige bottling, in partnership with Relais & Chateau, offered only in the finest restaurants worldwide. The bottle’s slender neck and slight taper are modeled after this original cuvée.

An innovative fruity red wine. The nose is flooded of fruit: strawberry, raspberry, cherry, blackberry, enhanced with floral notes of violet and lilac. Light spicy and toasted notes enrich the fruit. Its mouth is soft, silky and intensely fruity, with a refreshing acidity that lingers on the palate.

Campo Viejo was established in 1959, the current winery opened in 2001. The winery is located 100 meters above Logroño, in the Rioja region of Spain, and is partially built underground and integrated into the landscape. It is the first Spanish winery to be certified as Zero Carbon Footprint, and is staffed a fully female winemaker team.

In 1847, along the banks of Jacob’s Creek, Johann Gramp planted his first vineyard. His vision was to create great tasting wines that reflect the true character of the grapes and the land. To this day we live and breathe this vision by producing wines that showcase how each grape variety expresses itself when shaped by the soil and the sun of Australia. To care for the environment in which we operate, Jacob's Creek is also the first large Australian company to use 100% renewable electricity.

Perrier Jouet Grand Brut epitomizes the heritage of Maison Perrier Jouet, perpetuating the House’s tradition of brut champagnes. It is a harmonious cuvée in which the luminous notes of Chardonnay are perfectly complemented by Champagne’s two red grape varieties: Pinot Noir and Meunier.

The ancestry of Perrier Jouet Grand Brut can be traced back to 1846, when, in response to the preference of British connoisseurs for a drier taste, Maison Perrier Jouet launched its historic Cuvée K, the world’s first lightly dosed champagne in the style today known as “brut”. According to the House cellar books, Cuvée K was dosed at a sugar level of less than 5%, daringly little for an era when champagnes regularly contained up to 40%. Maison Perrier Jouet became renowned for its brut champagnes, which it was able to produce owing to the fact that its high quality grapes required very little added sugar, a philosophy maintained to this day. Perrier Jouet Grand Brut is the heir to this tradition, and the initiator of the famed Perrier Jouet style.

brandHighlight.data: Campo Viejo has a long history that takes us back to the Roman Empire. However, it has been only in the last century that our name became synonymous with Rioja wines. From our first vintage – brewed in the former Ortigüela winery in 1959 – to the creation of the famous ‘Rioja Bottle’ in 1961 and the unveiling of our new state-of-the-art sustainable winery in 2001, we have been at the forefront of Rioja winemaking.

Hints of vanilla, toast and the warmth of gingerbread
Notes of pink grapefruit and mandarin combined with the generosity of brioche. A subtle salinity and an impressively long finish.
Perrier-Jouët Belle Epoque Rosé is Floral & Extravagant - a versatile rosé, worthy of its iconic heritage.

Founded in 1811 by Nicolas Perrier and Adèle Jouët. The foundation of the estate, located in Épernay, has always been chardonnay. The maison owns 65 hectares of vineyards, 99.2% of which is Grand Cru, including sites in the Côte des Blancs - Cramant and Avize. This cuvée is inspired by the historic Blason de France (1955-1990), Perrier-Jouët’s first prestige bottling, in partnership with Relais & Chateau, offered only in the finest restaurants worldwide. The bottle’s slender neck and slight taper are modeled after this original cuvée.

Kenwood Vineyards' Yulupa Cabernet Sauvignon is crafted from select lots of wines with an emphasis on softness and drinkability. The grapes for this blend are primarily sourced from vineyards in California's Lodi and Clarksburg appellations.

Located in the heart of the Sonoma Valley, Kenwood Vineyards is dedicated to producing premium wines truly representative of Sonoma County’s world-class vineyards. Kenwood Vineyards was established in 1970 in the former Pagani Brothers Winery, a historic cellar dating back to 1906. Thoroughly refurbished and modernized, the facility now boasts more than 125 stainless steel fermenting tanks and large oak uprights, and 20,000 small French and American oak barrels, all devoted to Kenwood Vineyards’ “small lot” style of winemaking.

brandHighlight.data: Commanderie de Peyrassol is located in the foothills of the Massif des Maures mountain range, 10 miles from the Mediterranean Sea, between Cannes and Marseille. Existing as a winery for almost 800 years, Commanderie de Peyrassol has thrived as a sanctuary for gathering travelers, all the while holding true to its values of hospitality and conviviality. The estate consists of 1,000 hectares with 95 hectares planted to vineyards cultivated on dry, rocky clay and limestone soils. With effort from the current owner, Philippe Austury, to revitalize estates centuries old reputation, Peyrassol is now, more than ever, synonymous with great wines and celebrated generosity across the world.

description.data:
With almost 800 years of existence, the Commanderie de Peyrassol is considered a landmark in the history of Provence. More than a winery, the Commanderie has thrived for centuries as a sanctuary for gathering travelers, all the while, holding true to its precious values of hospitality and conviviality. 

Located in the foothills of the Massif des Maures, 10 miles from the Mediterranean Sea between Cannes and Marseille, the estate consists of 1,000 hectares, with 95 hectares planted to vineyards cultivated on dry, rocky clay and limestone soils. When Francoise Rigord and her husband managed the estate, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon were planted in addition to the Grenache and Cinsault already growing at the estate. The main white varietals are Rolle and Ugni Blanc, supplemented by Semillon and Clairette. Since Philippe Austruy took ownership of the estate in 2001, Peyrassol has consciously maintained organic practices in full respect of the surrounding environment, aiming for certification in the coming years. No synthetic fertilizers, pesticides or fungicides are used in the vineyards. The age of the vines, the rocky terrain, and the hot, dry climate all do their part to severely restrict yields. Consequently, harvests typically average between 25 and 40 hectoliters per hectare depending on the vineyard and grape variety. 

Inspired by the values at the origin of the estate: a sense of place, of great energy and centuries old commitment to hospitality, Peyrassol is now, more than ever, synonymous with great wines and celebrated generosity across the world.

text.data: The fruit selected for the Château wines comes from the oldest part of the estate with mainly old vines.

description.data: 2019 produced possibly the greatest vintage DAOU Mountain has ever experienced, with heavy rains during dormancy, moderate temperatures and extended hang time yielding a mighty harvest. The ample winter rainfall—close to 40 inches total—gave way to a healthy cover crop that replenished the soil’s micronutrient levels. The climate throughout the growing season was perfect, with temperatures mostly in the 80s and 90s, and not a single day reaching 100 degrees during the entire year. The harvested grapes arrived in exquisite condition, showing no damage, sunburn or shriveling. The resulting wines are marked by elegance and power, with moderate alcohols and great acidity that promise excellent longevity.

brandHighlight.data:
Located in Victoria’s Yarra Valley in Australia, Giant Steps is recognized as a global benchmark for cool-climate Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. The winery was established in 1997, when owner Phil Sexton arrived in the Yarra Valley in search of ideal sites to produce Chardonnay and Pinot Noir of purity and finesse.  Recognized globally for its pursuit of site expression, Giant Steps wines are among the most anticipated releases from Australia and regarded as benchmarks for the Yarra Valley.
  
In 1997 Phil Sexton arrived in the Yarra Valley in search of altitude, aged soils, slopes of exposure, regular rainfall and cool to cold night time temperatures and a gentle breeze off the protecting mountain ranges. Why, because he wanted to grow amazing Chardonnay and Pinot Noir fruit to make wines of purity and finesse. 

Steve Flamsteed, Chief Winemaker of Giant Steps since 2003 has set about creating a range of Single Vineyard wines that personify each site.  The Yarra Valley Chardonnay and Pinot Noir  were then created, clearly displaying the Yarra Valley fruit in a simple, textural and affordable light. 
 
The Giant Steps wines have received global acclaim and established a strong reputation in restaurants and fine wine stores around the world.

Since 2003 Giant Steps wines have collectively been awarded 34 trophies and over 100 gold medals at major international and domestic wine shows and has been named one of the Top 100 Wineries in the World by Wine & Spirits Magazine, US for each of the last six years.

description.data: After discovering Yarra Valley wines 25 years ago, Lou Primavera planted his vineyard in Hoddles Creek in 2001. We have a long-standing relationship with the Primavera family, having sourced fruit from the vineyard for several vintages. We are now producing a single vineyard Pinot Noir from Primavera vineyard, a testament to the increasing quality of this up and coming site. Fresh, juicy expression of Pinot Noir with rose petal and earthy flavors.  This bottle features a convenient screw cap for fresh wine and easy pouring. This bottled Australia pinot noir is 13% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Fresh, juicy expression of Pinot Noir with rose petal and earthy flavors.

brandHighlight.data:
Cambria Estate Winery is one of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Barbara County’s most iconic, storied wineries dating back to 1986 when it was founded by wine icon Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke. Today, the winery remains family-owned and operated, with daughters Katie (Katherine) and Julia Jackson serving as co-proprietors. The winery produces exceptional Pinot Noirs and Chardonnays that are the truest expression of its single-vineyard sourcing from its eponymous Julia’s Vineyard and Katherine’s Vineyard. Every wine bearing the Cambria name is 100% sustainably grown and produced on the estate.
  
Cambria Estate sits on storied land. Originally planted in 1971, and brought into the Jackson family by Jess Jackson and his wife Barbara Banke in 1986, Cambria’s land has been a premier producer of cool climate wines for more than 45 years. Situated on one of the only transverse valleys on the West Coast, Cambria’s vineyards are planted on the Santa Maria Bench where cool, sea air funnels in unobstructed from the nearby Pacific Ocean, blanketing the vines in maritime fog. With one of the longest growing seasons in California, the unique climate at the Estate produces “refrigerated sunshine” that develops concentrated flavors in the grapes making Cambria ideally situated for cultivating Chardonnay and Pinot Noir varietals.

Every Cambria wine produced is a single vineyard offering. The two primary vineyards on the Estate are Julia’s and Katherine’s. Named for Jess and Barbara’s daughters, these vineyards are marked by depth of character, and a history of acclaim – most recently when Wine Spectator named the 2017 Katherine’s Vineyard Chardonnay one of the Top 100 Wines of 2019. Each vineyard holds within it ancient Soils that include 14 different soil types, while each block contributes different flavor and structural qualities to the wines. Additionally, the 17 clonal varietals on the property are a study in diversity. With a commitment to craftsmanship and artistry, winemaker Jill Russell and the tremendous winemaking and vineyard teams bring to life the legacy of this land through each wine.

description.data: The Tepusquet Vineyard Syrah is a classic cool climate Syrah with balanced aromas, flavors, acid and structure. All grapes from our Estate Vineyards are certified under the California Sustainable Winegrowing Alliance and Sustainability in Practice. This medium bodied red wine has a deep purple color with concentrated dark berry flavors and aromas of smoked meat, spice and mocha. Balanced tannins and acidity lead to a smooth texture and long finish. Enjoy with lamb stew, short rib sliders, BBQ Baby Back Ribs, or a local favorite– or Santa Maria Style Tri-Tip with chimichurri sauce.  This bottled California syrah is 14.2% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: This medium bodied red wine has a deep purple color with concentrated dark berry flavors and aromas of smoked meat, spice and mocha. Balanced tannins and acidity lead to a smooth texture and long finish.

brandHighlight.data:
Benvolio displays true regional flavor and distinctive personality. Meaning "well-wisher" in Italian, Benvolio wines reflect their unique terroir and possess outstanding food-pairing abilities. Sourced from vineyards west of San Daniele del Friuli, along the cool hillsides of the Alps and the Austrian border, the wines have lively acidity and benefit from the cool temperatures of the region.
  
Our belief is that there is no place on Earth that cherishes the inseparable relationship between food and wine like Italy. So, it was only natural to challenge our local winemakers with the task of sourcing wines that reflect their unique, authentic terroir while possessing outstanding food-pairing ability. Benvolio is made from grapes grown by our farmers, friends and neighbors in Friuli, wines that display true regional flavor and have distinctive personality. Benvolio means “well-wisher” in Italian. As such, it is our wish that you enjoy the unmistakable flavors of our winemakers have selected for you.
Benvolio wines are from the Friuli region in the northeastern corner of Italy, an area known worldwide for its white wines. The soil is predominantly gravel and sand, which stresses the vines and allows for superior drainage. The vineyards benefit from a complex combination of microclimates, with warm air coming from the Adriatic Sea during the days, and cool night breezes drifting down from the snow-covered Alps. These are ideal conditions for grapes to mature slowly to perfect ripeness, providing full flavors and rich texture while retaining balanced acidity.

description.data: Benvolio Prosecco is an excellent expression of both the variety and the Friuli terroir. The Friuli region is in the northeastern corner of Italy, an area known worldwide for its white wines. Italy’s Friuli region is known for producing exceptional white wines crafted with balanced acidity, sugars and fresh ripe, structured fruit. This prosecco is vibrant, crisp, and refreshing. Benvolio Prosecco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosecco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp. Pair with fish, shellfish, chicken and white meat dishes.  This bottled Italy prosecco is 11% alcohol by volume.

tastingNotesText.data: Benvolio Prosecco sparkling wine is a true expression of Italian prosecco wine and the renowned Friuli region’s terroir – the vibrant, crisp acidity acts as a counterpoint to the flavors of ripe citrus, fresh peaches, lemon, green apples, and grapefruit. The finish is light, refreshing, and crisp.
